document_data.mainbody:
Wands of trap detection were magic wands that could aid individuals lacking skills of a rogue.
Wands of trap detection were usually slender and ebon in appearance.
Once activated, a wand of trap detection allowed the user to see all traps within the casters eyesight. Each wand could be used only once a day.
The most famous wand of trap detection once belonged to a half-elven wizard-rogue Illep the Watchful from Myth Drannor. He used the wand in his numerous burglaries to see snares and deadly springblades. Illeps illicit career was cut short by an unruly warrior Brammel who was offended by the half-elfs dandified appearance. In ensued tavern brawl, Illep died of an axe wound. Brammel was arrested, and the foppish thieves belongings, with the wand of trap detection, were sent to his relatives in Myth Drannor. Bandits attacked the caravan that was transporting Illeps belongings, and the wand became lost to history.
The wand resurfaced again in 1281 DR, just outside Kuldahar in Icewind Dale, at a ruined mill in the Kuldahar Pass, ransacked by marauding goblins.
